summary: The concept of "intermediate nuclear force," often referred to as "Euro-missile," pertains to the category of international security within EU legal and regulatory frameworks. This term encompasses treaties and agreements aimed at regulating the deployment and proliferation of nuclear weapons in Europe, particularly during the Cold War era. The EU's stance on Euro-missiles reflects its commitment to disarmament and collective security, emphasizing diplomatic resolutions over military escalation. As a redirect, "intermediate nuclear force" leads to "Euro-missile," underscoring the significance of this terminology in discussions surrounding arms control and the geopolitical landscape of Europe.
